section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: approved container terminal (認可貨櫃碼頭) means a container terminal specified in Schedule 2;
approved wharf (認可碼頭) means a wharf specified in Schedule 1; (27 of 2024 s. 3)

def.name: CertificateOfRegistry
def.leadIn: certificate of registry (註冊證明書) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate of registry or certificate of provisional registry granted under the Merchant Shipping (Registration) Ordinance (Cap. 415); or

paragraph.name: b

section.def: Class 1 dangerous goods (第1類危險品) means any substance or article falling within the class known as “Class 1—Explosives” in the IMDG Code;

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any substance or article falling within the class known as “Class 2—Gases” in the IMDG Code; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Class 2 dangerous goods as defined by section 2 of the Dangerous Goods (Application and Exemption) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. E); (E.R. 2 of 2012)

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any substance or article falling within the class known as “Class 3—Flammable liquids” in the IMDG Code; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Class 3 dangerous goods as defined by section 2 of the Dangerous Goods (Application and Exemption) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. E); (E.R. 2 of 2012)

section.def: Class 3A dangerous goods (第3A類危險品) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Dangerous Goods (Application and Exemption) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. E); (E.R. 2 of 2012)
consumer packs (消費裝) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Dangerous Goods (Application and Exemption) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. E); (E.R. 2 of 2012)
conveyance permit (運送許可證) means a permit granted under section 19;
dangerous goods anchorage (危險品碇泊處) has the meaning given by regulation 2(1) of the Shipping and Port Control Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. A);
Director (處長) means the Director of Marine;
freight container (貨櫃) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Freight Containers (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 506);

def.name: Handle
def.leadIn: handle (處理), in relation to dangerous goods, includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: loading, unloading, discharging and transferring the dangerous goods; and

paragraph.name: b

section.def: in bulk (散裝), in relation to dangerous goods, means carried directly and without intermediate form of containment in a hold, tank or cargo space fitted into or forming part of the construction of a vessel;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a type 1 or type 2 vessel, means the person for the time being in charge or command of the vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a type 3 vessel, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person for the time being in charge or command of the vessel; or

subparagraph.name: ii

section.def: non-pyrotechnic special effects material (非煙火特別效果物料) means any dangerous goods that are materials within the meaning of non-pyrotechnic special effects material under section 2 of the Entertainment Special Effects Ordinance (Cap. 560);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a type 1 or type 2 vessel, includes—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person named as the owner of the vessel in the certificate of registry issued in respect of the vessel;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the vessel is chartered by demise, the demise charterer and any person acting as the agent of the charterer; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the vessel is managed by a vessel management company, the company and any person acting as the agent of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a type 3 vessel, includes the person named as the owner of the vessel in a certificate of ownership issued in respect of the vessel under the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Certification and Licensing) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. D);

def.name: Passenger
def.leadIn: passenger (乘客) means any person carried on board a vessel except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person employed or engaged in any capacity on board the vessel on the business of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person on board the vessel either in pursuance of the obligation laid on the master to carry shipwrecked, distressed or other persons, or by reason of any circumstances that neither the master nor the owner could have prevented;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who handles or supervises the handling of any dangerous goods, carried in or on a motor vehicle on board the vessel; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a public officer who, in carrying out his or her duties, handles or supervises the handling of any dangerous goods on board the vessel;

section.def: pyrotechnic special effects material (煙火特別效果物料) means any dangerous goods that are materials within the meaning of pyrotechnic special effects material under section 2 of the Entertainment Special Effects Ordinance (Cap. 560);
Schedule 1 dangerous goods (附表1危險品) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Dangerous Goods (Application and Exemption) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. E); (E.R. 2 of 2012)
Schedule 2 dangerous goods (附表2危險品) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Dangerous Goods (Application and Exemption) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. E); (E.R. 2 of 2012)
tropical cyclone warning signal (熱帶氣旋警告訊號) means a tropical cyclone warning signal issued by the Hong Kong Observatory;
type 1 vessel (第1類船隻) means any vessel other than a type 2 or type 3 vessel;
type 2 vessel (第2類船隻) means any vessel that is specifically designed or constructed for the carriage of Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods in bulk but excludes a type 3 vessel;

def.name: Type3Vessel
def.leadIn: type 3 vessel (第3類船隻) means any vessel, whether or not specifically designed or constructed for the carriage of Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods in bulk, that is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: regularly employed in trading to or from Hong Kong unless registered in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: possessed or used for pleasure purposes in the waters of Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: employed in sea fishing plying regularly in the waters of Hong Kong, or using the waters of Hong Kong as a base;

section.def: western dangerous goods anchorage (西面危險品碇泊處) means the area of the waters of Hong Kong specified as the western dangerous goods anchorage in the Seventh Schedule to the Shipping and Port Control Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. A).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Meaning of dangerous goods in this Regulation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, subject to subsection (2), dangerous goods (危險品) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any substance or article falling within a class in the IMDG Code;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Schedule 1 dangerous goods;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Schedule 2 dangerous goods; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: any empty receptacle or any residue in a hold, tank or cargo space fitted into or forming part of the construction of a vessel, that has been used previously for the carriage of any dangerous goods mentioned in paragraph (a), (b) or (c), unless after having been so used, the receptacle, hold, tank or cargo space has been—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: gas freed or ventilated where appropriate; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the previous contents were radioactive, cleaned and adequately closed.

subsection.content: In this Regulation, dangerous goods does not include any dangerous goods referred to in subsection (1) that form part of the equipment, stores or fuel of a vessel.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Meaning of carrying on board Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods in relation to type 2 or type 3 vessels

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Regulation, a type 2 or type 3 vessel that has carried on board Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods in bulk is to be regarded as carrying those dangerous goods on board the vessel until a gas-free certificate is issued in respect of the vessel by a person approved by the Director.
A certificate issued under subsection (1) must be in a form specified by the Director.
The Director may approve a person for the purposes of subsection (1) if satisfied that the person possesses the necessary qualifications and competence to issue a gas-free certificate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: gas-free certificate (氣體清除證明書) means a certificate certifying that a vessel is free of gas.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Conveyance of dangerous goods by type 1 or type 2 vessels exempted from operation of section 6 of Ordinance
section.text: Section 6 of the Ordinance does not apply to the conveyance of dangerous goods by a type 1 or type 2 vessel.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Dangerous goods for personal medical use exempted
section.text: Dangerous goods of any reasonable quantity carried by a person for personal medical use on board a vessel are exempt from the operation of this Regulation.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Submission of dangerous goods manifests

subsection.leadIn: A type 1 vessel carrying on board dangerous goods must not enter the waters of Hong Kong unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a manifest in the form specified by the Director containing the particulars of the dangerous goods has first been submitted to the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director grants permission for the vessel to enter those waters without a manifest having been submitted in accordance with paragraph (a) subject to the requirement which may be imposed by the Director under subsection (2).

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), the Director may require the owner or master of the vessel to submit the manifest in accordance with subsection (1)(a) as soon as reasonably practicable after the vessel has entered the waters of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not include any particulars in the manifest which the person knows or has reason to believe to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: false in any material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: misleading by reason of the omission of any material particular.

subsection.content: If subsection (1)(a) is contravened, both the owner and the master of the vessel commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 2 months.
A person who fails to comply with the requirement imposed on that person under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 2 months.
A person who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Anchoring and berthing of type 1 vessels carrying Class 1 dangerous goods

subsection.leadIn: Unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 1 vessel carrying on board Class 1 dangerous goods must not anchor or berth at any place within the waters of Hong Kong other than at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the western dangerous goods anchorage; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a place that the Director may from time to time direct.

subsection.content: A type 1 vessel carrying on board Class 1 dangerous goods that has anchored or berthed in accordance with subsection (1) must remain anchored or berthed unless the Director permits or directs otherwise.
Subsection (2) does not apply if there is an emergency situation or if, to ensure the safety of persons on board the vessel or at the berth, it becomes necessary to move the vessel.
If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence to a charge under subsection (4) if the person charged proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to all the circumstances, the person exercised all the due diligence that the person ought to have exercised to prevent the commission of the offence.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Movement of type 1 vessels carrying Class 1 dangerous goods during tropical cyclone

subsection.content: Unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 1 vessel carrying on board Class 1 dangerous goods must not enter the harbour when a tropical cyclone warning signal higher than No. 3 is in force.

If a tropical cyclone warning signal higher than No. 3 is issued, unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 1 vessel that is in the harbour and is carrying on board Class 1 dangerous goods must, without delay, leave the harbour.
If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence to a charge under subsection (3) if the person charged proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to all the circumstances, the person exercised all the due diligence that the person ought to have exercised to prevent the commission of the offence.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Manifests required for loading dangerous goods onto type 1 vessels

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), dangerous goods must not be loaded onto a type 1 vessel unless a manifest in the form specified by the Director containing the particulars of the dangerous goods has first been submitted to the Director.

If, for any reasonable cause, it is not possible to submit a manifest in accordance with subsection (1), the manifest must be submitted to the Director within 48 hours after the dangerous goods are loaded onto the vessel or before the vessel departs the place at which the dangerous goods are loaded, whichever is the earlier.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not include any particulars in the manifest which the person knows or has reason to believe to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: false in any material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: misleading by reason of the omission of any material particular.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, both the owner and the master of the vessel commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 2 months.
A person who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Loading or unloading Class 1 dangerous goods onto or from type 1 vessels

subsection.leadIn: Unless the Director otherwise permits, Class 1 dangerous goods must not be loaded onto or unloaded from a type 1 vessel at any place within the waters of Hong Kong other than at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the western dangerous goods anchorage; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a place that the Director may from time to time direct.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 or to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence to a charge under subsection (2) if the person charged proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to all the circumstances, the person exercised all the due diligence that the person ought to have exercised to prevent the commission of the offence.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Loading or unloading of freight containers containing dangerous goods (other than Class 1 dangerous goods) onto or from type 1 vessels

subsection.leadIn: Unless the Director otherwise permits, freight containers containing dangerous goods (other than Class 1 dangerous goods) must not be loaded onto or unloaded from a type 1 vessel at any place within the waters of Hong Kong other than at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approved container terminal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a place that the Director may from time to time direct.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence to a charge under subsection (2) if the person charged proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to all the circumstances, the person exercised all the due diligence that the person ought to have exercised to prevent the commission of the offence.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Movement generally of type 2 vessels carrying Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods

subsection.leadIn: Unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 2 vessel carrying on board Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must not proceed otherwise than directly to or from—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a dangerous goods anchorage (other than the western dangerous goods anchorage); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a place that the Director may from time to time direct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must not enter or remain in the part of the harbour that is bounded—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on the east, by a straight line drawn on a bearing of 333° True from the position on Hong Kong Island at latitude 22°17.665´ North, longitude 114°11.977´ East to the mainland; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on the west, by a straight line drawn from the westernmost point of Hong Kong Island to the westernmost point of Green Island, and from there along the west coast of Green Island to the north-westernmost point of Green Island, and then from there to the position on Stonecutters Island at latitude 22°19.052´ North, longitude 114°07.768´ East. (L.N. 122 of 2024)

subsection.content: If subsection (1) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence to a charge under subsection (2) if the person charged proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to all the circumstances, the person exercised all the due diligence that the person ought to have exercised to prevent the commission of the offence.

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to the co-ordinates of a point is a reference to the co-ordinates of that point based on the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84).

section.name: s14
section.heading: Anchoring and berthing of type 2 vessels carrying Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods

subsection.leadIn: Unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 2 vessel carrying on board Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods must not anchor or berth at any place within the waters of Hong Kong other than at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approved wharf; (27 of 2024 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a dangerous goods anchorage (other than the western dangerous goods anchorage); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a place that the Director may from time to time direct.

subsection.content: A type 2 vessel carrying on board Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods that has anchored or berthed in accordance with subsection (1) must remain anchored or berthed unless the Director permits or directs otherwise.
Subsection (2) does not apply if there is an emergency situation or if, to ensure the safety of persons on board the vessel or at the berth, it becomes necessary to move the vessel.
If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence to a charge under subsection (4) if the person charged proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to all the circumstances, the person exercised all the due diligence that the person ought to have exercised to prevent the commission of the offence.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Movement of type 2 vessels carrying Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods during tropical cyclone

subsection.content: Unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 2 vessel carrying on board Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods must not enter the harbour when a tropical cyclone warning signal higher than No. 3 is in force.

If a tropical cyclone warning signal higher than No. 3 is issued, unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 2 vessel that is in the harbour and is carrying on board Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods must, without delay, leave the harbour.
If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence to a charge under subsection (3) if the person charged proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to all the circumstances, the person exercised all the due diligence that the person ought to have exercised to prevent the commission of the offence.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Precautions to be taken when Class 3 or 3A dangerous goods in bulk are being handled on board type 2 vessels

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), when Class 3 or 3A dangerous goods in bulk are being handled on board a type 2 vessel, all openings in the cargo tanks of the vessel with direct access to the open air, except those forming part of the ventilation system of the vessel, must be kept closed.

Subsection (1) does not prevent the opening of any ullage or sighting port in the cargo tanks for so long as is necessary to take dips or samples or make observations on condition that the ullage or sighting port is adequately protected by a flame screen that may only be removed for taking dips or samples or making observations.
If subsection (1) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence to a charge under subsection (3) if the person charged proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to all the circumstances, the person exercised all the due diligence that the person ought to have exercised to prevent the commission of the offence.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Application
section.text: Sections 18, 20, 23, 25 and 29 do not apply to pyrotechnic special effects materials conveyed in accordance with the requirements specified in the Entertainment Special Effects Ordinance (Cap. 560) by type 3 vessels.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Permits required for conveyance of dangerous goods by type 3 vessels

subsection.content: Except under the authority of a permit granted under section 19, a type 3 vessel must not convey any dangerous goods.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to the conveyance, by type 3 vessels of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any Schedule 2 dangerous goods in packaged form not exceeding the exempt quantity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any Schedule 2 dangerous goods in consumer packs;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any Schedule 1 or 2 dangerous goods that are exempt by virtue of the Dangerous Goods (Application and Exemption) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. E) from the operation of section 6 of the Ordinance in respect of conveyance at sea; (E.R. 2 of 2012)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods in bulk; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any radioactive substances that are subject to regulation 7 of the Radiation (Control of Radioactive Substances) Regulations (Cap. 303 sub. leg. A).

subsection.leadIn: If subsection (1) is contravened, the owner of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to—

paragraph.name: a
b

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: exempt quantity (豁免量) means the quantity of Schedule 2 dangerous goods in packaged form that is exempt by virtue of the Dangerous Goods (Application and Exemption) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. E) from the operation of section 6 of the Ordinance in respect of conveyance at sea; (E.R. 2 of 2012)
packaged form (有包裝) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Dangerous Goods (Application and Exemption) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. E). (E.R. 2 of 2012)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Granting of permit by Director

subsection.content: The Director may, on application and payment of the fee specified in Schedule 3, grant to any person a permit authorizing the conveyance of dangerous goods by a type 3 vessel.
A permit under subsection (1) may be granted in respect of any dangerous goods or any class of dangerous goods.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Type 3 vessels carrying Class 1, 2, 3 or 3A or Schedule 1 dangerous goods must not carry other dangerous goods

subsection.content: Unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 3 vessel carrying on board Class 1, 2, 3 or 3A or Schedule 1 dangerous goods must not carry any other dangerous goods.
If without reasonable excuse subsection (1) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Type 3 vessels must not carry passengers and dangerous goods at same time

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 3 vessel must not carry passengers and dangerous goods at the same time.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: Schedule 2 dangerous goods in consumer packs;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: non-pyrotechnic special effects materials, if section 18(1) does not apply to the conveyance of those materials by virtue of section 18(2)(c) and the requirements in subsection (3) have been complied with;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: liquefied petroleum gas contained in a cylinder having a water capacity of less than 130 litres or in a combination of cylinders having a combined water capacity of less than 130 litres, if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the conveyance of such liquefied petroleum gas is for and incidental to the production of entertainment special effects within the meaning of the Entertainment Special Effects Ordinance (Cap. 560); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the requirement in subsection (3)(b) has been complied with; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: pyrotechnic special effects materials, if the requirements in subsection (3) have been complied with.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements mentioned in subsection (2)(c), (d)(ii) and (e) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the conveyance of the non-pyrotechnic special effects materials or pyrotechnic special effects materials is for and incidental to the production of entertainment special effects; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each passenger on board the vessel is a holder of a special effects operator licence issued under the Entertainment Special Effects Ordinance (Cap. 560).

subsection.content: If without reasonable excuse subsection (1) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Passengers on board type 3 vessels used for franchised or licensed service must not possess Class 1 or Schedule 1 dangerous goods

subsection.content: A passenger on board a type 3 vessel used for a franchised or licensed service under the Ferry Services Ordinance (Cap. 104) must not possess any Class 1 or Schedule 1 dangerous goods.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the possession of manufactured fireworks belonging to Group 7 (firework) specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Dangerous Goods (Application and Exemption) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. E) in a quantity not exceeding 5 kilograms; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the possession of safety cartridges, cartridges for small arms or cartridges for any cartridge-operated fixing tool, the conveyance of which is exempt by virtue of the Dangerous Goods (Application and Exemption) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. E) from the operation of section 6 of the Ordinance. (E.R. 2 of 2012)

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: cartridge-operated fixing tool (彈藥筒推動打釘工具) has the meaning given by regulation 2 of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings (Cartridge-Operated Fixing Tools) Regulations (Cap. 59 sub. leg. R).

section.name: s23
section.heading: Type 3 vessels carrying Class 1 or Schedule 1 dangerous goods must not be towed

subsection.content: Unless the Director otherwise permits, a vessel must not tow a type 3 vessel that is carrying on board Class 1 or Schedule 1 dangerous goods.
If without reasonable excuse subsection (1) is contravened, the master of the towing vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Movement of type 3 vessels carrying Class 1, 2, 3, or 3A or Schedule 1 dangerous goods

subsection.leadIn: Unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 3 vessel carrying on board Class 1, 2, 3 or 3A or Schedule 1 dangerous goods must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter a dock; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry out in the harbour any repairs, other than running repairs to machinery for the safe operation of the vessel.

subsection.content: Unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 3 vessel carrying on board Class 1 or Schedule 1 dangerous goods must not be underway in the harbour between the hours of sunset and sunrise, except by reason of stress of weather or other unforeseen circumstances beyond the control of the owner or master of the vessel.
If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Anchoring and berthing of type 3 vessels carrying Class 1 or Schedule 1 dangerous goods

subsection.leadIn: Unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 3 vessel carrying on board Class 1 or Schedule 1 dangerous goods must not anchor or berth at any place within the waters of Hong Kong other than at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a place authorized by a conveyance permit granted in respect of the dangerous goods or explosives;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the western dangerous goods anchorage; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a place that the Director may from time to time direct.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 3 vessel carrying on board freight containers containing Class 1 or Schedule 1 dangerous goods must not anchor or berth at any place within the waters of Hong Kong other than at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a place authorized by a conveyance permit granted in respect of the dangerous goods or explosives;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the western dangerous goods anchorage;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an approved container terminal; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a place that the Director may from time to time direct.

subsection.content: Unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 3 vessel carrying on board Class 1 or Schedule 1 dangerous goods must not berth alongside another vessel except for the purpose of loading or unloading the dangerous goods or explosives, and then only between the hours of sunrise and sunset and for the period reasonably required for that purpose.
If subsection (1), (2) or (3) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Anchoring and berthing of type 3 vessels carrying Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 3 vessel carrying on board Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods in bulk must not anchor or berth at any place within the waters of Hong Kong other than at— (27 of 2024 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approved wharf; (27 of 2024 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a dangerous goods anchorage (other than the western dangerous goods anchorage); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a place that the Director may from time to time direct.

subsection.content: Unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 3 vessel carrying on board Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods in bulk must not berth alongside another vessel except for the purpose of transferring or receiving those dangerous goods as fuel or oily residue to or from the other vessel, and then only for the period reasonably required for that purpose. (27 of 2024 s. 6)

Subsection (1) does not affect the application of section 91 of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (General) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. F) in relation to the anchoring, berthing and mooring of a vessel from which or to which bunker is delivered.
If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Movement of type 3 vessels carrying Class 1, 2, 3 or 3A or Schedule 1 dangerous goods during tropical cyclone

subsection.leadIn: If a tropical cyclone warning signal higher than No. 3 is issued, unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 3 vessel that is in the harbour and is carrying on board Class 1 or Schedule 1 dangerous goods must, without delay—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: leave the harbour; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proceed to and remain at the western dangerous goods anchorage until such tropical cyclone warning signal is cancelled.

subsection.leadIn: If a tropical cyclone warning signal higher than No. 3 is issued, unless the Director otherwise permits, a type 3 vessel that is in the harbour and is carrying on board Class 2, 3 or 3A dangerous goods in bulk must, without delay—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: leave the harbour;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proceed to and remain at a dangerous goods anchorage (other than the western dangerous goods anchorage) until such tropical cyclone warning signal is cancelled; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: proceed to and remain at a private mooring laid for mooring a vessel during the passage of a tropical cyclone until such tropical cyclone warning signal is cancelled.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Precautions to be taken when Class 3 or 3A dangerous goods in bulk are being handled on board type 3 vessels

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), when Class 3 or 3A dangerous goods in bulk are being handled on board a type 3 vessel, all openings in the cargo tanks of the vessel with direct access to the open air, except those forming part of the ventilation system of the vessel, must be kept closed.

Subsection (1) does not prevent the opening of any ullage or sighting port in the cargo tanks for so long as is necessary to take dips or samples or make observations on condition that the ullage or sighting port is adequately protected by a flame screen that may only be removed for taking dips or samples or making observations.
If subsection (1) is contravened, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence to a charge under subsection (3) if the person charged proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to all the circumstances, the person exercised all the due diligence that the person ought to have exercised to prevent the commission of the offence.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Trained personnel required to handle dangerous goods on board type 3 vessels

subsection.content: The owner of a type 3 vessel carrying dangerous goods must employ a person who holds a valid dangerous goods certificate to supervise the segregation, handling, labelling, securing or stowage of those dangerous goods.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of the dangerous goods or radioactive substances to which section 18(1) does not apply by virtue of section 18(2).
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: valid dangerous goods certificate (有效危險品證書) means a certificate granted in respect of a dangerous goods training course recognized by the Director under section 30 and that has not expired.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Recognized training courses

subsection.content: The Director may, by notice in writing published in any manner the Director thinks fit, recognize one or more training courses for the purposes of section 29.
A person who organizes a training course recognized by the Director under subsection (1) may grant to a person who has satisfactorily completed the course a certificate to that effect.
A certificate granted under subsection (2) must specify a date of expiry of the certificate, which date must not exceed 5 years after the date of issue.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Permits required to discharge fireworks at sea

subsection.content: Except under the authority of a permit granted under subsection (2), a person must not discharge or cause to be discharged any fireworks at sea.
The Director may, on application and payment of the fee specified in Schedule 3, grant to any person a permit authorizing the discharge of fireworks at sea.
A permit under subsection (2) may be granted in respect of any fireworks or any class of fireworks.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Contravention of Director’s directions
section.text: If a vessel to which this Regulation applies contravenes a direction given by the Director under section 8, 11, 12, 13, 14, 25 or 26, the master of the vessel commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Power of Director to grant exemptions

subsection.content: The Director may in respect of dangerous goods at sea, grant an exemption, in respect of a specific case or a specific person, from all or any of the provisions of this Regulation, subject to any conditions the Director specifies.
The Director may vary or revoke any exemption granted under subsection (1).

section.name: s34
section.heading: Dangerous Goods (Shipping) Regulations repealed
section.text: The Dangerous Goods (Shipping) Regulations (Cap. 295 sub. leg. C) are repealed.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date of commencement of this Regulation;
Repealed Regulations (《被廢除規例》) means the Dangerous Goods (Shipping) Regulations (Cap. 295 sub. leg. C) as in force immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Permissions and permits granted immediately before commencement date
section.text: If, immediately before the commencement date, there was in effect a permission or permit granted by the Director under the Repealed Regulations in respect of any substance, material or article, then, on and after that date, the permission or permit is, for the unexpired period of its validity and subject to the same conditions to which it was subject immediately before that date, to be regarded as a permission or permit granted by the Director under this Regulation in respect of the same substance, material or article.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Dangerous goods manifests submitted in respect of type 1 vessels under Repealed Regulations
section.text: A manifest submitted to the Director immediately before the commencement date under regulation 4 of the Repealed Regulations is to be regarded as a manifest submitted to the Director under section 7 of this Regulation.
